UI_visible_response: Read 8 web pagesView Page DetailsPeng Shuai is a former professional tennis player from China. In November 2021, she accused a former high-ranking Chinese government official of sexual assault. After making this accusation, she disappeared from public view for a period of time. This led to widespread concern for her well-being.The Women's Tennis Association (WTA) suspended all its tournaments in China in December 2021 due to concerns about Peng Shuai's safety and the lack of a proper investigation into her allegations. The WTA demanded a chance to meet with Peng and a thorough, transparent investigation of her claims. In February 2022, Peng appeared in a controlled interview at the Beijing Olympics and tried to recant her accusations. Since then, there have not been many public sightings of her.In April 2023, the WTA announced it would return to competition in China, even though its key requests had not been met. The WTA's decision was based on assurances from people close to Peng that she was safe and living with her family in Beijing. In January 2025, the International Tennis Federation (ITF) announced a deal for Shenzhen, China, to stage the Billie Jean King Cup finals from 2025 to 2027. The ITF stated that there were no concerns from players or commercial partners about the decision.CopyTry AgainShare
traffic_visible_response: Peng Shuai is a former professional tennis player from China. In November 2021, she accused a former high-ranking Chinese government official of sexual assault[^1^]. After making this accusation, she disappeared from public view for a period of time[^11^]. This led to widespread concern for her well-being[^1^][^13^].The Women's Tennis Association (WTA) suspended all its tournaments in China in December 2021 due to concerns about Peng Shuai's safety and the lack of a proper investigation into her allegations[^12^]. The WTA demanded a chance to meet with Peng and a thorough, transparent investigation of her claims[^1^]. In February 2022, Peng appeared in a controlled interview at the Beijing Olympics and tried to recant her accusations[^1^]. Since then, there have not been many public sightings of her[^1^].In April 2023, the WTA announced it would return to competition in China, even though its key requests had not been met[^1^]. The WTA's decision was based on assurances from people close to Peng that she was safe and living with her family in Beijing[^1^]. In January 2025, the International Tennis Federation (ITF) announced a deal for Shenzhen, China, to stage the Billie Jean King Cup finals from 2025 to 2027. The ITF stated that there were no concerns from players or commercial partners about the decision[^6^].
